item.title: ME:: tl;dr-ing: Ocaml single file activity pub or something :-) NLnet; #Seppo!
item.description: Discovered: Feb 23, 2026 15:38 (UTC) ME:: tl;dr-ing: Ocaml single file activity pub or something :-) NLnet; #Seppo! <‚Äì QUOTE: Posting and liking self reliantly and still have a life. #Seppo! empowers you to publish short texts and images to the internet as easily as using an online service but retain full agency and responsibility. What you publish is solely subject to public law. No 3rd parties hold a stake, nobody else imposes any rules on you. This is because you publish on your own property. Which is possible because housekeeping is no more than the known follow/unfollow/block/unblock content moderation of your own single account. You do that by yourself. There are no scripting engines or databases, no technical updates required. You can focus solely on the message to deliver. You build an online presence on your own digital property, robust for decades if you decide so. #Seppo! is built on mature web standards (e.g. ActivityPub), a european technology stack, inspectable plain-text storage, is security aware and decentralised. It is made for but not limited to off-the-shelf static webspace as offered by numerous vendors all over the EU. #Seppo! targets individuals and small organisations joining the #Fediverse with max. 10k followers, optionally cross-posting to the closed platforms.

item.title: ME:: I guess I'll have to read a non fiction book :-) to read about how Apple is terrible in China ; Milo≈° Miljkoviƒá:: üìö Finished reading: 'Apple in China' by Patrick McGee // Infinite Regress
item.description: Discovered: Feb 23, 2026 15:25 (UTC) ME:: I guess I‚Äôll have to read a non fiction book :-) to read about how Apple is terrible in China ; Milo≈° Miljkoviƒá:: üìö Finished reading: ‚ÄúApple in China‚Äù by Patrick McGee // Infinite Regress <‚Äì QUOTE: The second is why they did it: to increase shareholder value. This is as far away from the 1984 athletes and the 1997 crazy ones as you can get. There was no reason why Apple products could not have been made around the world ‚Äî per the book, Samsung has only a token presence in China, and manufactures its chips in Korea in the US. But at what cost? And with what margins? Profits seduced the company right into a quicksand trap. McGee and his interviewees have a difficult time imagining it escape.

item.title: Installed Rogers 5G Home Internet Ultimate plan, my upload speed has gone up 1500% (from less than 1Mb/s to 15MB/s or more on Telus's antiquidated DSL service). I want Telus Fiber but not available because accountants (?!?) see linked cosocial.ca thread :-)
item.description:
• Draft created: Feb 21, 2026 06:13 (UTC).
  • Rogers 5G Home Internet
  • cosocial.ca thread (no disrespect to accountants and other financial ‚Äòengineers‚Äô :-) ):‚Äù

do you remember fixed wireless access from the 90s and 2000s at Nortel? Neither do I :-) It‚Äôs 2026 so I have Rogers 5G Home Internet and it‚Äôs upload speed is 10x my Telus DSL. Apparently, Telus won‚Äôt turn on their fiber until their accountants tell them to for our 1995 10 unit condo (by 2030?) and I can‚Äôt have both Shaw and Telus because my condo only has 1 wire (it‚Äôs supposed to have both by law but reasons?!?!). So I bought this service on a lark :-) since there‚Äôs no contract.

Sounds like it‚Äôs time to switch to Shaw cable internet which has the same upload speed. I call Telus every year and ask about fiber but I‚Äôm fed up waiting for them to turn it on :-) My neighbours in a brand new 4 plex across the street have Telus fiber so it‚Äôs ready, just need to flip a switch or so I am told by Telus contractors :-) but accountants or something :-)

I have been told conflicting stories about Telus fiber IRL at Telus‚Äôs store and also by Filipino :-) call centre agents in the Philippines and by Telus contractors who installed the fiber that goes to all of the newly built residential buildings on my block . Oh brother :-)

And I am 100% sure that Telus fiber if/when I get it, will be a lot better than Rogers or Shaw or Fixed Wireless Access from Rogers or Fido but I‚Äôm fed up waiting :-) and calling yearly. I‚Äôve called once year since at least 2018 LOL

@tedmielczarek ‚Äúfiber to the curb‚Äù is our situation not ‚Äúfiber to the riser‚Äù is what i believe what we called it in the Nortel days (I worked there for 13 years!!!)

item.title: ME:: I wonder if Mr. Kupperman is still predicting the guillotine will fall in 2026 ; Harris Kupperman:: August 25, 2025:: Global Crossing Is Reborn... - Praetorian Capital
item.description: Discovered: Feb 20, 2026 02:02 (UTC) ME:: I wonder if Mr. Kupperman is still predicting the guillotine will fall in 2026 ; Harris Kupperman:: August 25, 2025:: Global Crossing Is Reborn‚Ä¶ - Praetorian Capital <‚Äì QUOTE: At the end of the day, this AI cycle feels less like a revolution and more like a rerun. I‚Äôve seen this story before‚Äîfiber in 2000, shale in 2014, cannabis in 2019. Each time, the technology or product was real, even transformative. But the capital cycle was brutal, the math unforgiving, and the equity holders were ultimately incinerated. AI will be no different. The datacenters will be built, the chips will hum, and some of the capacity will eventually prove mind-blowingly useful. But the investors footing the bill today will regret ever making the investment. That‚Äôs how bubbles end‚Äînot with a bang of innovation, but with the slow, grinding realization of negative returns, for years into the future. When shareholders finally wake up to the fact that AI isn‚Äôt generating cash flow, only burning it, the guillotine will fall‚Äîon management, on the stocks, and on the broader market that bet its future on a fantasy.
